channel.title: Forage vs. Assassinate
channel.description:
Foraging is very powerful. Confusing roleblockers is just a bonus - the real power in this is the ability to choose your target during the day when claims are made and being almost guaranteed (pants on fire, magical barrier) to land your ability.
Think of the risk involved with Assassinate;
1) Attacking a target under the protection of CW, Merc, or Prince. 2) Attacking a target being guarded by a Knight or healed by a Physician or Alchemist 3) Getting caught by an Observer 4) Running into a Princess' Wisp 5) Hitting an immune target 6) Hitting a target that was going to die anyway 7) Hitting an incorrect target due to Scorn's Bait and Switch 8) Hitting a target protected by the King
Forage risks:
1) Observer sees you didn't visit anyone/didn't leave (slightly sus to some) 2) Physician healing every poison 3) Allowing important BD roles to live longer instead of killing them immediately 4) Getting Pants on Fire'd or hitting a target with Magical Barrier (this will never happen) 5) Accidentally poisoning a Physician who is immune
As we can see, Physician hard counters the wanna-be arso assassin. Because of this, I will typically try to assassinate the first couple nights and see if I can score a hit on the Physician. If NK kills Physician, hey, thanks pal. Time to forage away.
There are times and places to assassinate, but in my experience it tends to fail almost as often as it succeeds, putting Unseen at a huge disadvantage.

item.title: Forage vs. Assassinate
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
You can also make people think it’s Cult for a night or 2

Read full topic

item.title: Forage vs. Assassinate
item.dc:creator: RopeStringFace
item.description:
Poisoning the physician should be grouped in with the physician healing every poison

Read full topic

item.title: Forage vs. Assassinate
item.dc:creator: Sketch
item.description:
Indeed. It is also better to forage earlier in the game because poison takes a while to take effect.

Read full topic

item.title: Forage vs. Assassinate
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
This is a good idea. I have seen some people forage N1 so they can do this more often. That way you can also have a poison ready if the MM conversation fails because of Prince/NK

Read full topic

item.title: Forage vs. Assassinate
item.dc:creator: RopeStringFace
item.description:
The poisoning assassin can’t distract.

I like to do a between: when prince/sheriff is revealed, poison someone else so phys is distracted, then kill the important one.

Read full topic

item.title: Forage vs. Assassinate
item.dc:creator: Hippolytus
item.description:
Same they really ought to increase his spawn rate.

Read full topic

item.title: Forage vs. Assassinate
item.dc:creator: Unknown
item.description:
Yeah the Nightshade Assassin…
If there is no CW and no Physician, then well… its bad.
If you are CW then you better use these Pants on Fire, because those who are on fire cannot be Assassin when poison hits the Prince/Sheriff. Bonus points if you make the Assassin nightshade themselves. And you might want to do Protective Barrier on someone who revealed after a poison if you run into someone like that.

Read full topic

item.title: Forage vs. Assassinate
item.dc:creator: Sketch
item.description:
I swear I NEVER get a Physician on my team when I spawn BD. Physician is like a 10% spawn rate…

Read full topic

item.title: Forage vs. Assassinate
item.dc:creator: Hippolytus
item.description:
I remember a while ago they decreased butler spawn rate, so clearly the chances of each BD role spawning is not equal. I would like to see an increase in Physician spawn rate as in my opinion one does not exist often enough to put off Assassin using forage and poison as his primary method of killing.

That OR make Alchemist able to heal nightshade to make him more valuable to BD and once again nerd the popular foraging strategy.

Read full topic

item.title: Forage vs. Assassinate
item.dc:creator: Hippolytus
item.description:
Oh okay. Arso implies he can suddenly get a bunch of kills on a night but I kinda get it I guess.

Read full topic

item.title: Forage vs. Assassinate
item.dc:creator: Sketch
item.description:
Just when you poison everyone instead of assassinating.

It’s like a silent killer type of deal and delayed, sort of like the arso.

Read full topic

item.title: Forage vs. Assassinate
item.dc:creator: Jazz
item.description:
There.
Is.
No.
Such.
Thing.
As.
Arso.
Assassin.
FFS.

item.title: Forage vs. Assassinate
item.dc:creator: Sketch
item.description:
Foraging is very powerful. Confusing roleblockers is just a bonus - the real power in this is the ability to choose your target during the day when claims are made and being almost guaranteed (pants on fire, magical barrier) to land your ability.

Think of the risk involved with Assassinate;

  1. Attacking a target under the protection of CW, Merc, or Prince.
  2. Attacking a target being guarded by a Knight or healed by a Physician or Alchemist
  3. Getting caught by an Observer
  4. Running into a Princess’ Wisp
  5. Hitting an immune target
  6. Hitting a target that was going to die anyway
  7. Hitting an incorrect target due to Scorn’s Bait and Switch
  8. Hitting a target protected by the King

  1. Observer sees you didn’t visit anyone/didn’t leave (slightly sus to some)
  2. Physician healing every poison
  3. Allowing important BD roles to live longer instead of killing them immediately
  4. Getting Pants on Fire’d or hitting a target with Magical Barrier (this will never happen)
  5. Accidentally poisoning a Physician who is immune

As we can see, Physician hard counters the wanna-be arso assassin. Because of this, I will typically try to assassinate the first couple nights and see if I can score a hit on the Physician. If NK kills Physician, hey, thanks pal. Time to forage away.

There are times and places to assassinate, but in my experience it tends to fail almost as often as it succeeds, putting Unseen at a huge disadvantage.
